column5: Oh my goodness what a journey you‚Äôve been on. I threw up for 7 straight months when I was pregnant. Like you, it just became part of my day. I didn‚Äôt worry what I ate anymore, it was going to come up anyway. It was so awful, I can‚Äôt imagine it lasting years. Glad to hear your Mom is well and you‚Äôre doing better.

Give it some time. It can take up to 6 weeks to get the full benefits. Also remember pregnancy rightfully so, can cause fluctuations in mood.

ETA: I‚Äôm sure patience isn‚Äôt the silver bullet answer you were hoping for but it‚Äôs necessary. Also try talking, asking her if she needs to talk and remember to be an active listener instead of an active fixer. She probably wants to feel heard, seen and understood. Best wishes
How long has she been on Zoloft?

Happy cake day!

Also this is 100% scripted of my Mom, except instead of my Dad enabling her it‚Äôs my sister. Good times
Yes of course. Soon To Be eX
Oh gosh I‚Äôm sorry. Nausea is the worst!  Hope we both get to feeling better. Happy holidays. :)
Shark eyes is the term I‚Äôve often heard used to describe it. Stbx narc has it too even with crystal blue eyes they turn black as hell.

We think that keeping our ovaries means we won‚Äôt have any hormonal change but that‚Äôs incorrect and our doctors don‚Äôt bother telling us. The effects of anesthesia and the surgery trauma itself screw with the functionality of the ovaries for awhile. It takes a few weeks (everyone‚Äôs a little different) for them to get back online and producing your normal hormone levels. 

So you definitely can have sore enlarged breasts, mood fluctuations, change in arousal/libido, weight gain/loss, etc. I would say I felt pretty leveled out around 4-5 months.
Thank you so much for the encouragement.üôèüèº
Thank you üôèüèº

I‚Äôm still protecting him. He‚Äôs got a sizable list of illegal activity and should not be in the position of power he is. I‚Äôm afraid for others, afraid for myself, afraid for his employers (even though they‚Äôre also his flying monkeys) and the young women he‚Äôs in contact with regularly. I know I need to get past the fear of others seeing me as vindictive, cruel or whatever because his behavior doesn‚Äôt just affect me regardless how outsiders perceive it. 

Thank you for this!

I‚Äôve been thinking through this lately. A recent situation with my Mom who frequently engages in passive aggressive behavior mixed with my avoidance of conflict is a bad combination. It triggers me hard. I have 2 responses, freeze is my usual and I hate it, and the rare fight response when I become very argumentative. Neither are good or solution based responses. 

But the current situation requires addressing and I‚Äôve been wrestling with it for a month. Ugh
Very welcome :)
No contact

Remember that the freeze response (all the F‚Äôs) is involuntarily. Your nervous system doesn‚Äôt ask how you‚Äôd like to respond to a perceived threat. It decides for you. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs an autonomous nervous system. It does what it wants.

The freeze response is our reptilian response. We just metaphorically play dead hoping the predator will pass.

Exciting news to hear!!  
I had mine earlier this year, February, and am now in the midst of a long overdue divorce. Haven‚Äôt had sex since :,( and I‚Äôm utterly terrified when I eventually do. I feel like a born again virgin in some bizarre way haha
Thank you again. Just the awareness is a great first step.

Thank you!
I‚Äôve been on quite the journey this year. Is there anything specific you can direct me to to begin learning how to harness it?  Learning is my favorite!

Hmmm interesting. I have lost several very close relatives in recent years. 
I‚Äôve made a mental note to tune in better the next time it happens, which won‚Äôt be long because it‚Äôs a frequent occurrence.
Thank you!
[This](https://www.verywellmind.com/depression-when-you-quit-smoking-2825274)  may be helpful
You‚Äôre welcome!  I don‚Äôt know where we‚Äôd all be without each other sharing our knowledge.

I didn‚Äôt really.  I had a lot of things, not great things going on at the time and brushed off how I was feeling as stress and not sleeping.  I finally talked to my doc about it because it was really starting to effect my life negatively. Days without getting dressed, completely lacking motivation, constant ruminating, like stuck in a mental loop infinitely.
No I did not

I quit for 5 months (dammit) last year and can relate to much of what you said.  I had a metric ton of life issues going on around the same time, 2019 was a real asshat. I did end up diagnosed with depression and anxiety.  I‚Äôm surprised that weed isn‚Äôt giving you any relief, it was the only break I had in the hell my mind was in. You may want to see your doctor to talk about how you‚Äôre feeling.  It‚Äôs not uncommon to go through a season of depression and/or anxiety when you quit.  In the meantime maybe try some cbd tincture that‚Äôs specific for stress/anxiety. It can be really helpful! 

Stay the journey man, proud of you!

I had it too. Definitely a hormonal thing. Even though you kept your ovaries (I did too), the effects the surgery, anesthesia and, depending on what you read, missing your uterus may also have an effect on hormone production for awhile.  It take your ovaries a few weeks to get fully back on line after surgery.  So no worries, your boobs will be back to normal and not painful soon. :)

Wow!
He took his ring off a few months ago.  His dating profiles were already up while he was professing his undying love before we filed, just weeks out.  A thread on a few more reasons why it‚Äôs not just a normal heartbreaking breakup. It‚Äôs psychological warfare.

I hadn‚Äôt thought about it this way. We‚Äôve been separated 7 months, I threw him out. He left willingly but thought it was for a couple days and he‚Äôd be back. 2 months later I filed, unable to serve him for 2 weeks, in that time he also filed and I was served the following day. Frustrated! We ended up having to work from his petition even though I filed first. So in theory, he filed for divorce and has not stopped saying he loves me and doesn‚Äôt want this to happen. Even after meditation and a settlement agreement. 
But you‚Äôre right he‚Äôs intent on playing the poor me game. 
Thanks for the perspective adjustment!
What was the resolution?  Aside from practicing releasing the tension in your jaw/face?

Keep notes on your cycles and pain between now and your appointment so you can give her a clear perspective on what it‚Äôs like. I know how brain zapping it can be once you‚Äôre sitting in stirrups. :/
Happens to me often and I‚Äôve never dry swallowed it. I don‚Äôt quite understand what causes it to happen sometimes and other times not.

Yes. I can‚Äôt remember exactly how long ago I tried ablation, 12 years maybe. Also never missed a cycle and they increasingly got worse then I added an enormous amount of stress and bled 3 weeks a month for about a year. Though I also had cysts and fibroids when I finally agreed to the hysterectomy. But my original gynecologist had been recommending surgery for years prior. 
I think your failed ablation should be a good factor in helping your doctor decide if a hysterectomy is ideal.

Omg yes!  We‚Äôd be trying to solve a problem or come up with a creative solution and I‚Äôd come up a genius idea, he‚Äôd brush it off as useless. The next day he‚Äôs got a great idea and regurgitates MY idea like it just came to him in a burst of brilliance.  I called him out on it every single time, which was probably weekly.
Yes. i didn‚Äôt notice any difference in the effectiveness.

I moved my dose from morning to dinner time and what a difference it made! If I was nauseous I slept through it. Plus I know taking it with food helps and I‚Äôm not a breakfast person so I take it after I eat at night.

Also nobody told me that NSAIDs can and do interact with Zoloft causing ..... nausea!

This is an important question!  I had my surgery in February and am doing fine now aside from an incisional hernia but I hate my surgeon so much!

Don‚Äôt go into surgery with a doctor you don‚Äôt 100% feel safe, listened to, SEEN AND HEARD by!

Have you read any of the books?  I just finished The Vortex and it has a very very clear explanation that‚Äôs easy to understand. 

We aren‚Äôt denying the negative emotions or experiences. We accept that we‚Äôre co-creating everything in our reality. I we want something different than what is, we have to give more attention to what we want than what we don‚Äôt want (negative). 

I can speak first hand on this. Depression, anxiety, panic & anxiety attacks, suicidal ideation, an abusive marriage. Those things were completely consuming me, every minute of my day. And no it was not like I flipped a switch and decided to think positive and my life was amazing. It‚Äôs definitely not like that. However once you decide that what you‚Äôre doing isn‚Äôt moving the needle, in fact things were getting worse every day, you‚Äôll do anything to stop that momentum. 

I started with meditation, those few minutes of clearing my thoughts of everything. Sometimes it was only 30 seconds I could shut it down but it was 30 more seconds than I had the day before. And the next time it was a full minute, and so on and so on. Today I stop and meditate whenever I choose and can get in the zone in a second. Mindfulness techniques are amazing throughout your day, connecting to the present moment. 

Sometimes we try to make LOA more woo woo than necessary.  It‚Äôs rather simple. The past is gone, I cannot do one thing about my mistakes or the mistakes of others so why would I waste another minute ruminating on it? Tomorrow isn‚Äôt even here yet, why am I spending so much energy worrying about it. Now is now, I want to be here NOW in my most joyful happiness fullest self. When I am, the rest falls together.

Yes is the short answer.  Most anything you read on the effects of narcissist abuse include addiction, self harm, self sabotage and the like as signs or symptoms. 

[This is a ](https://blogs.psychcentral.com/recovering-narcissist/2017/08/11-signs-youre-the-victim-of-narcissistic-abuse/) good article that includes addiction as a sign of narc abuse, on Psyc Central by Shahida Arabia. She‚Äôs a great resource of information.

For what it‚Äôs worth (the original comment is deleted so I‚Äôm going off your response) my attorney suggested I do a joint credit check in addition to the one I already did on myself. I haven‚Äôt yet so I can‚Äôt give you any info about it.  We‚Äôve been separated 2 months and haven‚Äôt filed yet.

That‚Äôs a good question, I used to ask myself too. I wondered if I was addicted to meditating. I wasn‚Äôt, that‚Äôs ridiculous. If you‚Äôre using an app and choosing different meditations each time, it may be more beneficial when you find one that really feels with you, do it every day for awhile, it will become a natural flow of energy and help with your practice.

I was feeling that way also. I‚Äôm going through quite the life transition and in the process I‚Äôm finally dealing with and healing a lot of my trauma. I was worried that the blunted emotions were hurting my healing progress. You have to feel to heal. But I also knew how much Zoloft was helping the depression and anxiety which has been important especially right now so I decided to stick with it. I started at 50 in January and upped to 100 in May I believe (the blunted emotions came with the dose increase).  A few weeks ago I noticed I was experiencing emotions again but not in an intense way, it was more comfortable or manageable. I don‚Äôt feel like a slave to my emotions but rather that those feelings come gently and I can feel them and process them and move through.

I started at 50 and had a similar experience as you. Once I increased to 100 things improved substantially. Also pretty quickly after the increase and the usual side effects of an increase dissipated within just a few days. 

I wouldn‚Äôt be too worried about increased side effects with a dose increase, it‚Äôs certainly nothing like when you first started taking it.

I‚Äôm finishing a course on Insight Timer (great app btw, both the free and paid version) working with the chakras. I highly recommend the app, thousands of meditations on any topic you can imagine. 

The root chakra is located at the base of your spine, your tailbone. Imagine a red light at this space.
Pro tip: older does not mean safe. My stbx covert narc is 15 years older than me. Had custody of his 3 kids when we met, (I also had 3) and now I‚Äôm clawing my way out of 18 years of hell!

I don‚Äôt know why I hadn‚Äôt even thought about this!  Before the we started dating he got a dui. I was his built in designated driver for the next 18 years, every dinner out, every party, event, every single time we left the house after 5pm I was responsible for driving. EVERY SINGLE TIME!  I was solely responsible for getting all 6 kids to and from each activity, play date, anything that happened after 5, I was responsible. 

His public image has elevated substantially since we got married. I wonder how long it will take before he falls. I‚Äôd much rather he stay put and not put himself or others in harms way but he‚Äôs far too self focused to consider others.

I can relate to this. The only nice gifts I‚Äôve ever received were directly tied to love bombing after something terrible, cheating, me catching a new std, pathological lying he couldn‚Äôt wiggle out of or the one off occasions that he needed to impress outsiders by showing what a great gift giver he is. 
When in reality 90% of the time I get things like a pillow for Mother‚Äôs Day or a seat cushion for an office chair (one of those things at the checkout ‚Äúas seen on TV), an afterthought gift from the airport. While I‚Äôve taken him on surprise vacations, bought him a new TV and surprised him by installing it in the wee hours of the morning, a fire pit.. 
it‚Äôs sick when you slow down enough to think about it.

I guess everyone‚Äôs situation re: divorce is different but I don‚Äôt think it ever gets better with a narc. They‚Äôre always the same person, control is their priority and in divorce they don‚Äôt get to be in control. 

If I had the money to pay the retainer I‚Äôd file yesterday. For me I want to be the one that files, it‚Äôs important to me to make that statement, not necessarily to him but to myself.

My stbx narc takes an hour long nap every single day. Our whole life has revolved around his sleep. He‚Äôs 60 now but even in his 40‚Äôs he napped, I suppose he‚Äôs been doing it his whole life. And not a lay on the couch or on top of the covers on the bed. He gets naked in bed like it‚Äôs night time kinda nap. His lunch break is easily 2.5 hours from work. 

I remember how stressful traveling with him and all 6 kids was. He demanded absolute silence in the car, from 6 children while he napped and I drove. I don‚Äôt know how I didn‚Äôt lose my mind then or have an accident trying to manage 6 kids to not so much as sneeze or cough much less talk or whine while driving his demanding controlling manipulative ass around.

I didn‚Äôt mention that it was Labor Day. Also the anniversary of his Dad‚Äôs death 2 years prior. 

They really are all the same. To the point of no originality and wondering if they have secret cult meetings to coordinate the sadistic behavior. 

I‚Äôm sorry you too have experienced this. I hope you‚Äôre on the road to healing.

Nope!!!

Married almost 18 years. I had 3 kids when we met and he was the first person I orgasmed with. At the time I thought it was almost a miracle. I‚Äôve had 3 kids, been divorced and not once had an orgasm with another person in the room. 

It wasn‚Äôt him though, it was all the love bombing and how he made me feel which I now know was fake!  He truly wasn‚Äôt interested in my pleasure though he made it seem like he was. He was only interested in how I made HIM feel. My pleasure was only about how accomplished and amazing it meant he was. Not about me feeling good for the sake of me feeling good. 

The sex quickly deteriorated. I can‚Äôt go into details because I haven‚Äôt even processed most of it but coercion and abuse is top of the list.  I remember the look on his face and the tone of his voice the last time we had mutual masturbation (because I‚Äôve not let him touch me since February, in fear of my health). I had a great O and he said ‚ÄúLooks like I‚Äôve been replaced‚Äù about my vibrator. His ego was wrecked because I got off in front of him without him, though he‚Äôs begged me to do that exact thing hundreds of times. But this time it was my idea, all me. 

So no, I don‚Äôt miss his twisted controlling sex. I can do it better without him because I actually love me.

Run so so fast!  My narc literally begged me to marry him. I lost count how many times he asked before I finally caved. He started depriving me of sleep (we didn‚Äôt live together but he‚Äôd stay over or show up at 3 or 4am). When I finally said yes it was 4:30am in the dark, on my front porch. He didn‚Äôt even have the ring with him. He was just frantically doing anything he could. 

I didn‚Äôt see or understand what was happening then, 18 years later it‚Äôs all so crystal clear. 

Do not make the same mistakes I did, that so many of us did!

My husband did the opposite. Told me he would do anything, I could call him for anything. But when I did he ignored it, made excuses for why he didn‚Äôt respond to my calls, texts or emails. Usually it was the same story that his phone was on vibrate and he didn‚Äôt hear it. It reinforced the cognitive dissonance I was experiencing. He wants to help and be there for me, he said so. But when I ask him for help he finds every reason not to and ultimately makes it my fault for not asking in a way that he needed me to. 
I asked him to leave 4 weeks ago üëåüèº.
But I wouldn‚Äôt get upset if you didn‚Äôt lie to me so... ;)
Good job!! You did that.
This is a great reminder, thank you. They do have a way of making it our responsibility. I wouldn‚Äôt have to lie to you if you didn‚Äôt get so upset. üôÑ

I think we‚Äôre all that way. I can spot manipulative behavior a mile away when it‚Äôs not my circle or my narc. It‚Äôs our conditioning, specific to us and our narc, our details and our weak points I think.
So so brilliant!  I have a couple letters I need to send you. After your toddler has emptied their bowels. Lol üòÇ parenthood at its finest.
Haha üò≠üò≠
I‚Äôve been getting off the ride a little sooner than usual. It‚Äôs nice.

The day I asked my husband to leave (3 weeks tomorrow) I was so emotionally unstable and had been for 2 days. I kept asking him to please stop. He didn‚Äôt stop. I completely lost control of my already out of control emotions and charged at him. I didn‚Äôt hit him or swing, it was a bizarre flailing at him. But he didn‚Äôt look upset or concerned at all, he had that smirk as he‚Äôs reaching for my flailing arms.  Minutes later I told him he had to go. It‚Äôs a terrifying thing to realize the pure joy he had while I was in the depths of hell.
New Mexico whataburger has Hatch Green Chile. Options
It‚Äôs the absolute most important use of time. We all need to do more of it to bring back the joy, happiness and utter fulfillment of life.  These are the things that fill your soul.

Maybe your wife and my husband are soulmates. They would drive each other to insanity instead of us. 

I‚Äôve been sliding deeper and deeper into depression and having panic and anxiety attacks because I think I just couldn‚Äôt handle it anymore. Instead of recognizing how much I‚Äôm struggling, or listening to me tell him I needed support, patience, kindness, he just kept pushing and pushing and pushing. Watching me spiral down, not caring one bit with his actions though he said he did. I asked him to leave 2 weeks ago.

Thank you, very helpful. I think I‚Äôm going to give it a go. I have to shave every day and if I get the chills it‚Äôs like I never shaved at all. I mean I don‚Äôt HAVE to but I‚Äôm not a fan of that prickly feeling.

Be absolutely straight and tell your therapist what you just told us. That the physical symptoms of your panic and anxiety have become debilitating and you need more help than you‚Äôre currently getting, you would like a referral. If you don‚Äôt get one you can usually take yourself depending on where you are. In the US most (I just discovered this myself) communities have a mental health clinic available with a sliding scale payment option if that‚Äôs something you need. If you have insurance, you may want to check for in network providers and start there. 

Good luck, don‚Äôt be afraid to say what you need.

How long once you started using the IPL before you noticed a difference?  I‚Äôm not really familiar with it and had pretty much decided to schedule a laser consult this week but also the $$$ is a bit of a problem. 

Do you let the hair grow to use it?  I‚Äôm specifically interested in my legs. I have terrible folliculitis that is flared up so bad from stress and I cannot deal with it anymore.
I agree but I also think that extended screaming often happens because no one is tending to the emotional needs of the child. Reaching deeper than the tantrum to get to the real issue.

Why haven‚Äôt I meditated high before?

Thanks for this. I desperately needed a different perspective. I‚Äôm early, very early in the process but I‚Äôm riddled with fear of losing so much, though none of it is him but what comes with being with him. Our home, financial stability, our friends (they‚Äôre not my friends, so why do I care). 

I‚Äôm going to start looking and thinking about it differently, I‚Äôm not losing anything, but I‚Äôm gaining everything!

I was 27 and he was 41 when we got married. We both had kids and previous failed marriages. His ex was ‚Äúcrazy, manic, institutionalized, unstable‚Äù so was his ex girlfriend.  His friends aren‚Äôt or weren‚Äôt younger but he filled that gap through his kids and their friends to a sickening level.  The early years of our marriage my primary complaint was he treated me like the 7th child in the family, spoke to me like a child and expected me to obey him like a child. 

He‚Äôs turning 60 this year and I‚Äôm turning into the woman I was meant to be. 4 days NC.

My anxiety and panic is the worst first thing in the morning. I routinely wake between 3:30-4:30 and nearly always have panic attack before I‚Äôve gotten 1/4 cup of coffee down. Normal, not normal? I think it‚Äôs relative. I‚Äôm starting to notice that my awareness of it has been helpful though, knowing my brain, body and emotional habits of you will. 
I listen to a guided meditation when falling asleep every night now, work on be present and mindful the second my eyes open and just sitting or stretching a minute. That doesn‚Äôt mean I don‚Äôt still panic but I can calm myself quicker when I can be more aware. 

I wish you some success and calm in your mornings, I know how upsetting it is starting your day that way.

If it helps, I‚Äôm new to severe anxiety. I‚Äôve probably had the normal healthy variety of having conversations in my head that I know will never happen irl the majority of my adult life. I don‚Äôt remember much of my childhood. I also regularly talked to myself in what I discovered was normal and even considered helpful. 

Since the anxiety hit hard that‚Äôs all changed. I don‚Äôt talk to myself anymore like I did. For example, I would work out solutions during work (work alone) or problem solve, reminde myself of things I need to do etc.  I‚Äôm silent now. But I‚Äôm having full conversations with people that I‚Äôve been hurt by, some were 20+ years ago, things I‚Äôve never processed. Like you mentioned, lips moving but almost under my breath while still being audible. It was upsetting when I first noticed it. I‚Äôm in my head a lot, alone 90% of the time, no outlet for those feelings. 
I agree it‚Äôs definitely an anxiety response. If I couldn‚Äôt look back at 43 years of my own history I may not be so sure but I know what I‚Äôm going through rn and #%?! It‚Äôs been hell. 

I don‚Äôt have suggestions other than yep, same.  You‚Äôre not alone.
